intro: Meliosma brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian meliosma, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Meliosma brasiliensis is often found growing in shaded, humid environments along riverbanks and in dense forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
